To get cooperative behavior you may want to take a look 
at "cooperative co=
evolution."  (You can find it on Google)  There is 
also the potential for =
rewarding cooperation explicitly in a real-
time evolutionary scenario like=
 NERO.  While NERO does not do this 
explicitly, in principle it is possibl=
e if the meaning of 
cooperative is formally defined.

ken

oogroups.com, "Mridul" <p_mridul@...> wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> I am planning to =
do my MS thesis on Swarm Intelligence using NEAT. 
In
> Ken's interview wit=
h Tom Barbalet of biota.org, he mentioned that 
NEAT
> uses competition to =
weed out the least performing individuals and
> species, but they are essen=
tially independent of each other.
> 
> Is it possible to have the entities =
co-operate in some way to 
obtain
> swarm intelligence? Also, I would like =
to expand on this using
> heterogeneous agents (some sort of symbiosis betw=
een agents).
> 
> Any suggestions/ thoughts?

> Regards,
